title: IT stares at slowest quarterly revenue growth in a decade
description: The third-quarter results season will begin with TCS and Infosys announcing their results on January 11, followed by HCLTech and Wipro on January 12. The focus this quarter will be the commentary on the demand environment and 2024 budgets.
content: Indiaâ€™s top technology companies, which together have the second highest weighting on the Nifty just behind the financials and banks, will likely report their slowest quarterly revenue expansion in a decade in the three months to December, although inherent client concentration and domain strength differences indicate a K-shaped growth path for the aggregate industry.Seasonality and deal ramp-ups are likely to aid sequential constant currency revenue growth at HCLTech (6%), LTIMindtree (1.5%), and Tata Consultancy Services, or TCS, at 1.5%. By contrast, revenue declines are expected at Wipro (-2.5%), TechMahindra (-1.6%), and Infosys (-1.4%), brokerage firm Jefferies said, adding that it expects significant divergence in revenue growth across companies.
